Control Name: 2.16.1 Error budgets used to track service reliability.
Control Statement: An error budget describes the maximum amount of time that the application can fail without consequence, and is typically calculated as 1-Service Level Agreement (SLA). For example, if the SLA specifies that the application will function 99.99% of the time before the business has to compensate customers, the error budget is 52 minutes and 35 seconds per year.

control_attributes.Control_Clause: 2.16 What operational excellence allowances for reliability have you made?
